website_summaries.verdict: This deluxe backpacking chair is a perfect choice for hiking trips, camping excursions, and much more.
pros: Oxford cloth seat is designed to withstand rain, sleet, and other harsh weather conditions
Ergonomic chair ensures you can relax any time you choose
Foldable design enables you to set up or take apart the chair without delay
Available in myriad colors, ensuring you can find a chair that complements your personal style
cons: Less durable than many comparable backpacking chairs

customer_reviews.title: The positives is that it is super light and fits into it's tiny carrying case
customer_reviews.text: I go camping a lot and sometimes when you can't bring your car and have to carry all your gear in, the last thing you want is a heavy chair. I bought this as an alternative to the bigger camping chair. The positives is that it is super light and fits into it's tiny carrying case. If you position yourself right it can be pretty comfortable. It feels like its not sturdy, but it is designed to hold up to 300lbs. The downfall is that it is really low to the ground, so if you have issues getting up and down, this is not the chair for you.
customer_reviews.author: kelly9484

customer_reviews.title: Great Off Brand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lightweight chair that compacts very well into a small bag. I have taken it out to quite a few soccer games and one campout and it has been a very nice, light and easy accessory that is not hard to pack around. It seems to be very well made, at least comparable to the much more expensive Big Agnes Helinox chair which is more than four times as much. This is a great little chair. I am 6'1" and 185lbs and it fits me well. It is not a deep chair, nor does it have a high back; so don't expect that type of comfort. However, I can sit quite comfortably in it without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Danite

customer_reviews.title: Compact and functional
customer_reviews.text: If storage/suitcase space is your primary concern, get this chair. It folds and stows in a bag which is about the size of a Chipotle burrito or Subway footlong. It's easy to assemble, and is comfortable to sit in for an hour or 2. The seat is low to the ground and you sit in a slightly reclined position. The fabric is slightly stretchable and durable. The aluminum legs are well made.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Weber

customer_reviews.title: Would've been awesome but...
customer_reviews.text: The chair is pretty cool - I really love the side pouches on it and it's not difficult to assemble. Very light weight and portable - the pouch it comes in is fairly small. It would've been awesome except it arrived with 1 bent leg - making the chair unstable when sitting. I'm so disappointed because I bought it for a camping trip this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Bre

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This chair is great. It feels decently secure under me (175lbs). Yet it’s very light weight and packs down to a very small size. I needed a chair that would fit in my motorcycle luggage and this fits the bill well. It’s not much, if any, bigger than a Nalgene bottle. It’s also much cheaper than anything similar to what you would find at a camping store. For what it is, it’s quite comfortable. It’s not as nice as a full sized camp chair, but when size and weight are at a premium, this thing is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Josh G.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, comfortable but fragile
customer_reviews.text: My son’s chair bent out of shape and a bit tight to put together but is light to carry and reasonably comfortable for sitting. So I’m still using the one that didn’t bend out of shape for backpack camping but would caution all to be wary and only sit very level surface to avoid any strain on the supporting struts
customer_reviews.author: Footcenter

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep in your trunk and carry around with ...
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have stated, this is a small chair -- but it's exactly as described. Great to keep in your trunk and carry around with you in case you ever need a seat, super lightweight, and a lot more comfortable than other portable chairs.
customer_reviews.author: LLJE

customer_reviews.title: Hasnt failed me yet
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable piece, pretty light, and exceptionally compressible spacewise. It hasnt ripped on my yet and that has surprised me. A lot better than most camp chairs. The breathability of the mesh is cool but you better be sure you have some thick clothes on if you dont want mosquitoes biting you through it.
customer_reviews.author: AustinT

customer_reviews.title: this is a must have!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very useful and portable. It folds up very small and is convenient to carry around. It is also very comfortable! The first couple times I used it I had a hard time putting it together but as you sit in it more it stretches a little and becomes easier to put together. I love this chair!
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it and ended up buying a second one because it was so perfect! Super comfy and great size! I think it’ll be perfect for festivals!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle F

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, compact and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for comic con cause we will be waiting in line for hours. We set them up at home to try them out and my hubby almost fell asleep. I like that they have a higher back then most sling chairs I’ve sat it. I also like the pockets, it will be convenient for holing snacks and our phones wile we wait in line. Hopefully they hold up, I will revise my review if I need to after we put it through the test in a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: SCB

customer_reviews.title: Great Chairs
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and easy to carry. The webbing on the chair's carry bag makes it easy to strap to something, but these travel small enough to even ride inside the backpack. They're small chairs, but for concerts and such these are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, packable, great for hiking.
customer_reviews.text: bungee-loaded chair frame, easy setup, and packability are all pluses. The seat is a little smaller than I anticipated, but it made for a great backpacking/hiking chair. It is not the most comfortable, but when you need to pack light, it is an amazing chair to have!
customer_reviews.author: OutdoorDataDude

customer_reviews.title: The chair is very durable and breaksdown/sets up easily. I'm 5'3"
customer_reviews.text: The chair is very durable and breaksdown/sets up easily. I'm 5'3", 130# and it's a very comfy seat. It does lean back quite a ways but you get used to it. Pockets on the side fit phones, books, and beer+beercoozey! My reason for 4/5 stars is that it would not fit in my rucksack for backpacking with all of the other stuff inside so it'll have to strap to the outside and it's not obviously ultra lightweight. Some taller/heavier friends tried it out and didn't like the low seat or the recline.
customer_reviews.author: Karissa Culley

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: If one has short legs this is a very light and portable chair. I found it a little awkward to dis-assemble and get it back into its case. Comfortable to sit in. If you have long legs this may not be the chair for you.
customer_reviews.author: Edmond Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and compact
customer_reviews.text: This chair is perfect. It's lightweight, comfortable, easy to set up and fits inside my small daypack. It's perfect for chilling out at mellow festivals like my small town music in the park. I had a similar one that lasted a couple years. I hope this one does, too. I'm getting an extra just because.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for motorcycle shows
customer_reviews.text: Great Chairs, I was looking for compact chairs to take to Car shows and on trips that would not take up a lot of space. These fit the bill perfectly. They are not too hard to assemble or disassemble. Unlike others, I had no issues getting up out of these.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Theriot

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble chair
customer_reviews.text: Great camping chair! I bought this item for canoe camping. It is very lightweight and small while still being sturdy and durable. The snap together feature is idiot-proof - there is no wrong way to put it together and the fabric went right on the frame with very little struggle. Also, the color is as vibrant in person as in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but will still make good use of the chair
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is lightweight, which is a plus. What was a minus for me is there isn't a sling strap on the outside. So, for instance, if you're going fishing, there is no convenient way to tote the chair with you. Disappointing, but will still make good use of the chair.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Great packable lightweight chair
customer_reviews.text: What a great packable chair. You have to wrestle with the canvas to fit it over the polls (you think it won't fit, but it does) but once one, the chair is comfortable. I wouldn't suggest for a larger person. I'm 5'6" and 140lbs and it's a snug fit when sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Teresina

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: I had this less than 2 months when the support pushed through the fabric on one of the top corners. When it pushed through, besides me hitting the ground one of the bottom supports bent so there was no way to fix the chair. I weigh 220, so im well under the max weight. Id spend the extra money and get a better quality one like my REI one that I have owned for about 5 years now with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5' tall and 150lbs. This chair is way ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5' tall and 150lbs. This chair is way to small for my behind! Since I can't see my behind, I'm not sure how big it is, but goodness, you would have to have a butt the size of a 5 y/o to fit this chair. I bought it for camping, will still take it with us, my 2 1/2lb papillon can use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice comfy chair.
customer_reviews.text: After several camping trips, I'm please to say that this is a nice little chair. Easy to assemble (no instruction, but it really is self explanatory) I'm pushing the weight limit, and it works and has held up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Cournoyer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading!
customer_reviews.text: It was a big disappointment! Rather misleading I'll say! It fit a child quite comfortably and supports my 120 lb. frame alright but I wouldn't allow my 280 lb. husband use it! I got an ALPS mountaineering leisure chair for him and it's a much superior product, much better value!
customer_reviews.author: S. Stone

customer_reviews.title: So compact and light!
customer_reviews.text: Very light and compact! Easy to put together and take down . I gave 3 stars strictly because I'm 5'11 and hubby is 6 feet and I have a feeling he won't be too impressed. My butt hangs off the edge. Not for tall people in my opinion. My toddler absolutely loves it! Bought 2 of them for beach and camping trips but may only keep one for my 3 year old. Hoping it will be a great beach chair 👍
customer_reviews.author: Doniel

customer_reviews.title: The kids fit great, but the grown ups (of normal human size ...
customer_reviews.text: Our only complaint about these is that they could use just a little more room for an adult bum. The kids fit great, but the grown ups (of normal human size and arrangement) eventually slide out. Love the light weight, easy set up, easy packing, and so far, durability.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: Compact, convenient chairs for small RV or backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and break down. Comes with a storage bag with loops for lashing to backpack. Higher weight rating than some others.
customer_reviews.author: PfromSEA

customer_reviews.title: A great chair
customer_reviews.text: What a great little camp chair. Perfect weight small footprint. Great for rafting.
customer_reviews.author: Bob T.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Compact Chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compact chair! Very easy set up and take down. It is hard at first to stretch the seat part over the legs but once you get a system it gets easier. My only complaint is how far you sit back. I would have liked the chair to sit more upright. But other than that, it's a good chair!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small and not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than expected. I’m 5’8” average size and I don’t fit in the chair. Not comfortable at all! It doesn’t really feel all that sturdy either. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy little chair that's held up well
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy little chair that's held up well. It's low to the ground, which is nice when some people are sitting on the ground. I wouldn't trust it for people on the heavier side.
customer_reviews.author: riselikethemoon

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome! I have brought it camping
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I have brought it camping, kayaking and to concerts and love it. It's sturdy and lightweight and comparable to the same big name brand chairs that look like this for a fraction of the cost. I weight 120 lbs and am 5'5 and am pretty comfortable in it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal G.

customer_reviews.title: This chair is not very comfortable for an adult
customer_reviews.text: This chair is not very comfortable for an adult.The problem for me was the shallow depth of the seat itself,thus the four star review.The chair is lightweight and very easy to assemble with the shock cords taking all the quesswork out of which part goes where.It has nice big pads on the bottom of the legs which prevent it from sinking too far into the sand,and the pockets on the side of the chair are a bonus.It fits nicely into the small carry bag.With it's very reasonable price this chair is good for children
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chairs!
customer_reviews.text: We love our compact camping chairs. We put them in our kayak to have a place to sit when we dock. They’re light enough for a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hafer

customer_reviews.title: We love these chairs and use them regularly to watch softball ...
customer_reviews.text: We love these chairs and use them regularly to watch softball games. They are heavy duty, pack light and pack small. They are comfortable and roomy. We love them.
customer_reviews.author: Slight

customer_reviews.title: Save trunk space for family campouts
customer_reviews.text: Use these for the kids. They are strong enough for me but too low to the ground. They are a little wobbly but work well enough. I love how much trunk space they save when camping.
customer_reviews.author: scwman

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great chair! It's a little stiff to set up at first, but very good quality for the price! The side pockets even hold a frosty beverage.
customer_reviews.author: The Seamstress of Misadventure

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, lightweight, portable. Brought it to the beach for the first time the other day, while everyone was lugging their beach chairs I had mine just in my bag. I will say it's not as comfortable as a regular beach chair since there are no armrests and it is low so you can't lean your head back, but I mostly got this for camping and for my purposes it's perfect, 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: LanzLiebz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and compact, but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Other people may enjoy this chair because it really is super compact and a pretty color but I personally hated it because it was uncomfortable. It's just too small to be comfortable- I feel like a meatball when sitting in it. Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlynn Hart

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, I'm having to return these. They are ...
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I'm having to return these. They are just too difficult for my hubby and I to get in and out of.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Portable and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Great to fold up and pack in. It leans a little far back for me, but a great relaxing, portable, lightweight chair. I hope it lasts a long while too, it seems like it will.
customer_reviews.author: julibikes

customer_reviews.title: Very compact and easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: Upside is: Very compact and easy to carry...Downside: not for a larger bodied person. Small seating room.
customer_reviews.author: Akasha R. Babos

customer_reviews.title: Not the easiest to set up. Takes a little ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest to set up. Takes a little more time than you would expect with all the pieces. Works well though.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Leans back a LOT
customer_reviews.text: Super portable and easy to set up. It is comfortable, but I don't love how far it leans back.I feel like I'm reclining in a La-Z boy getting ready for a nap, haha.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: A tad too small
customer_reviews.text: These are great for their price, but not very comfortable. We were hoping for higher back, but they do well for short periods of time. Sturdy, and good for camping!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very compact!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for a motorcycle trip/camping and they breakdown small enough for the room we had.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: thought it would be more sturdy. We wanted it for the beach but I ...
customer_reviews.text: it's okay. thought it would be more sturdy. We wanted it for the beach but I don't think it's a beachy chair. Would probably be best on more solid ground.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chair!
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair! Used a couple times backpacking and even in house. Works great all the way up to my spouse’s 230lb self!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy207

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light weight camping
customer_reviews.text: Works great and it's really portable for lightweight camping ... the days of hauling heavy gear are over!!!
customer_reviews.author: Reuben Flores

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing how small this chair folds up
customer_reviews.text: The most compact chair you'll find. It's amazing how small this chair folds up, easy to toss into a backpack with other items and gear.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Son Enjoys - Lightweight & Simple!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 7yo son to use camping. He seems to like it, and it's small enough that he can carry it around himself. He likes that, and his mom & I definitely like that! :)
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price. Very light weight
customer_reviews.text: Good light weight chair for price. Has pockets to hold wallet or cell phone
customer_reviews.author: C. F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light travel
customer_reviews.text: Love this little chair! Excellent buy. I pack this in a motorcycle sack and take it camping with me!
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: great chair
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair! Keep it in my jeep at all times...assembly takes about a minute and half...super comfy...definitely going to purchase more
customer_reviews.author: mas82647

customer_reviews.title: This chair would be perfect for someone who want to bring a chair hiking ...
customer_reviews.text: This chair would be perfect for someone who want to bring a chair hiking with them and be able to fold it up nice and compact. But It's not an ideal chair otherwise. As an adult my but slides down and almost off the chair easily. My daughter picked the chair for camping and she fits great in it, but She's also only 4.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Holding up well
customer_reviews.text: I strap this chair to my fatbike and head for the trails. I go 220 and haven't had a problem yet. I've used it maybe 10 times so far and it's holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: staying awake

customer_reviews.title: these will be great on our kayak trips or any other outdoor event ...
customer_reviews.text: bought two. these will be great on our kayak trips or any other outdoor event where we need something easy to carry. They're very light.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: This chair works great once I figured out how to set it up
customer_reviews.text: This chair works great once I figured out how to set it up. Watched a YouTube video. I used it for a Lacrosse tournament that I had to fly to, fit perfectly in my carry one and didn’t add too much weight
customer_reviews.author: WeRymple

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The chair is super comfortable and packs up super small for my backpacking trips. I
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly sturdy when I tested it indoors
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly sturdy when I tested it indoors. Have not used on the beach or the outdoors yet. Will see how they will fare.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect grab and go chair for my mans football games! Pretty sturdy for how small it is.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I am 250 lbs man, and it really holds ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 250 lbs man, and it really holds up a takes my weight, the specs calls out that it can take more than 300 lbs, this chair really practice what it preaches
customer_reviews.author: German

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to my backpack for light weight chair
customer_reviews.text: Perfect addition to my backpack for light weight chair. Fits great on the outside of pack and hardly could tell the difference in weight. I will always make room for this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Ward

customer_reviews.title: Anywhere, Anytime 👌🏾
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair, I bought it for a deployment and there’s not one place I haven’t used it. On ship, in the field, and in a regular room. Never had an issue with it holding me up (I weigh 170 lbs) and it’s easy for me pack up with the rest of my gear. Highly recommended for military and outdoor camping.
customer_reviews.author: DuBose

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are very small chairs. They will only fit a small sized adult, or a child.
customer_reviews.author: Soccer Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble and dis-assemble. Folds nicely into a very small carrying bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A nice light weight folding chair. Compact and easy to take with
customer_reviews.author: Steven T. Christie

customer_reviews.title: I like this for backpacking as a light chair
customer_reviews.text: I like this for backpacking as a light chair. I would not take it events like festivals and/or where you may be sitting on non-level ground
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Good small chair
customer_reviews.text: Great size to carry with a hiking pack. Sets up easily and is durable. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Haiduk

customer_reviews.title: Husband approved!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is tall and about 230 lbs- he fits well in the chair and loves it. Great for a compact camping chair.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Just received this chair and the package was literally ripped ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received this chair and the package was literally ripped open, then retaped. The chair is supposed to come with a Velcro strap for the poles, but instead has a plain rubber band. I need this chair for a trip tonight so I can just send it back. I guess we'll see if it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: needs to be worked on
customer_reviews.text: The locations where the aluminum leg rest is not very well designed, they need to be reinforced.
customer_reviews.author: John Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Bent a leg on first use.
customer_reviews.text: Bent a leg the first time I used it. As comfortable as the chair is I probably won't use it again as one of the legs bent while I was in Utah on a camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Perfect chair, great value.
customer_reviews.text: Chair was cheaper than many others on the market but after a few months is still holding up like new and is just the perfect size and weight. The straps on the side of the carrier enable easy attachment to my pack or other bags.
customer_reviews.author: P. Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Light weight, fit back into carry bag easily. Easy to set up. But, to be perfectly transparent I returned them when I discovered that there is a high back version, which I then ordered.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as I thought
customer_reviews.text: Not as comfortable as I thought. Took to a music festival and hurt my back after a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Julie N.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great chair for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chair for the price. It's a little wobbly and leaning back in it doesn't really feel supportive but if you're looking for an inexpensive camping chair this is easy to set up and compact!
customer_reviews.author: Michaela Holsinger

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product for anyone that weighs more than 175 ...
customer_reviews.text: I just came back from a camping trip. After seven days of use, one of the legs is bent and the attachment point in the fabric is beginning to rip loose. I would not recommend this product for anyone that weighs more than 175 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy  Williams

customer_reviews.title: Sits okay and comfortable but hard to get out of
customer_reviews.text: Ad was not clear that it is very low to the ground. Sits okay and comfortable but hard to get out of.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela R. Harrelson

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: The company was very nice to work with and met my complete satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: CAJ

customer_reviews.title: & foldable BUT broke easily. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Attractive chair, light weight, & foldable BUT broke easily. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: CHERI S.

customer_reviews.title: Chair broke with sitting in chair
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed in this product. I used it around 4x till it torn. :-( I weigh about 195lbs.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: If you gotta carry a chair for a long ways this is a good one.
customer_reviews.text: Small and light. If you gotta carry a chair for a long ways this is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent backpacking chair
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent backpacking chair! Super lightweight, easy to assemble and great to sit on after a long day.
customer_reviews.author: S Ballam

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Too small for 200 pound lady! Too hard to get out of!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very portable
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think this folding chair would be this portable, much lighter in weight than expected too. Setting it up the first time took a little longer because I didnt' know what goes where but still fairly easy. Once I get the bottom frame all together, putting on the "chair cover" was easy and believe it or not, this lightweight folding chair can bear weight up to 330 Ib according to the listing description. All baseball or soccer moms would need one of these :)
customer_reviews.author: Doleman

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 155 and it broke while I was sitting in it. One of the legs buckled but did not snap. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nope

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, easy to assemble. Used on the beach. Much better than sitting on a blanket. Loved the 2 side pockets. Used one for a cup holder. Excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice for a child, small for an adult, no neck support so I returned it. Customer service is relentless with its emails trying to make me “happy” and sell me a new chair, it’s an email every few days. I’ve asked them to stop and was sent a message basically saying they can’t stop. So I’ll change the review to a 4 and maybe they will leave me alone about it.
customer_reviews.author: FeelnRain

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Colour is true to
customer_reviews.text: Very fast delivery. Great product! Colour is true to picture
customer_reviews.author: Mela

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but a good chair.
customer_reviews.text: It's OK but it is a low chair so you for a 6"1 person like me you need to fall into it and roll out. But once your in it. Its very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: thomas garcia

customer_reviews.title: Child sized
customer_reviews.text: Returning. Item Too little. Would be better suited for a child. But it is a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Laura R

customer_reviews.title: No Good!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 15 year old son to take camping. First it ripped where one of the legs goes into the seat, then two of the metal legs bent and it no longer is usable. I can't imagine it supporting up to 330 pounds. Not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey M.

customer_reviews.title: ... makes it very unnerving and difficult to really get comfortable in.
customer_reviews.text: The fact that the chair doesn't go into place without "force" from sitting it makes it very unnerving and difficult to really get comfortable in.
customer_reviews.author: Monique K.

customer_reviews.title: We take these everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Love these chairs. They are a tad on the heavy side, but not enough to leave them at home. These chairs have been to Death Valley and all the way up to Glacier with stops in between. Perfect for backpacking with a little extra comfort.
customer_reviews.author: L

product_meta.title: FBSPORT Lightweight Folding Camping Backpack Chair, Compact & Heavy Duty Portable Chairs for Hiking Picnic Beach Camp Backpacking Outdoor Festivals
feature_bullets: HIGH DURABILITY: Camping chairs are made of 1000D Oxford cloth with high-strength aluminum alloy frame. Our heavy duty backpacking chair weighs only 2 pounds which can hold up to 242 pounds/110kg.
SUPER COMFORT: Unique and ergonomic camping chair design gives you the best seat experience allowing you to relax. Breathable and soft camp chair net makes you feel comfortable while you sit.
Simple Setup: Aluminum shock-cord pole structure makes for camp chairs easy assemble. Ergonomic design provides extra stability. Velcro strap to hold the frame together when collapsed.
Ultralight & Portable & Practical: compact picnic chairs ,camping chairs folding Weights only 2.2 lbs, Additional storage bags and carrying bag, which is easy to carry and take on.

VERSATILITY: The folding chairs outdoor for Backpackers, Tailgaters, Hikers, Concertgoers, Campers, Adventurers, and anyone looking for comfort without the bulk. A decent HOLIDAY GIFT for friends and families.
